subclass.name: College of the Battlesong
subclassFeatures: If I Can Do It, So Can You|Bard|PHB|Battlesong|BB5E|6
Cower, Villein! Thy End is Nigh!|Bard|PHB|Battlesong|BB5E|6

subclass.name: Flame Hammer Domain
subclassFeatures: Channel Divinity: Shield of the Forgemaster|Cleric|PHB|Flame Hammer|BB5E|2
Channel Divinity: Blade of the Forgemaster|Cleric|PHB|Flame Hammer|BB5E|6

subclassFeature.name: College of the Battlesong
entries: Votaries of the College of Battlesong are masters of blade and prose. While some feel that they need to prepare and perform for civilians, Battlesongs find their masterpieces amongst the clang of swords and blasts of cannons. This conductor of war inspires their allies and cuts down their enemies for the longer they play the more cacophonous their song of battle becomes.

Battlesong bards become adventurers for the hunt of combat and the release of inspiration with the bloodletting of their enemies. They focus heavily on orchestrating combat and become more powerful with each swing of the blade and firing of the arrow.

subclassFeature.name: BattleSong Readiness
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned to perform despite the harsh, demanding conditions of the battlefield. You gain proficiency in medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Dirge of Doom
entries: At 3rd level, as a bonus action, you may spend 1 use of Bardic Inspiration to play a Dirge of Doom for one minute. When you begin your performance, choose either attack rolls, physical saving throws, mental saving throws, or ability checks. At the start of their turn, enemies that can hear the dirge of doom must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or take a -1 penalty on the selected rolls until the start of their next turn. At the end of each of your turns thereafter, the penalty worsens by 1, to a maximum penalty of your proficiency modifier.

Your Dirge of Doom ends early if you are in an area of magical silence or are otherwise unable to produce sound, such as being in a vacuum, or if you are affected by any condition that prevents you from taking an action on your turn. Maintaining the Dirge of Doom does not require any additional actions on subsequent rounds, and creatures that are deaf are unaffected by it entirely, as are creatures immune to the Frightened condition.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Boast
entries: At 6th level, you have mastered the art of championing the prowess of your comrades-in-arms, proudly proclaiming their strengths to the world at large. As a bonus action, you may spend 1 use of Bardic Inspiration to grant an ally other than yourself a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus on one skill check that they already have proficiency in. This is an extended performance, and the effects last for as long as the skill check takes, up to an hour per use of Bardic Inspiration.

subclassFeature.name: If I Can Do It, So Can You
entries: At 6th level, you can speak up when you see someone being oppressed and harden their resolve. As a reaction, when a creature within 30 feet of you makes a saving throw against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}, you can start a performance per the Countercharm feature. The creature gains advantage on the saving throw as part of the performance.

subclassFeature.name: Cower, Villein! Thy End is Nigh!
entries: At 6th level, you’ve learned how to focus your Dirge of Doom, lambasting your foes with focused, targeted, and genuinely quite hurtful remarks, describing in detail how brutally your comrades will obliterate them, or other means of verbally roasting your enemies. As an action, you may choose one creature currently affected by your Dirge of Doom. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened of you until they are no longer affected by your Dirge of Doom, either by making their save against the Dirge, or if the Dirge ends for any reason.

This ability may affect no more than your Charisma modifier in creatures at once, as there is a limit to how many creatures you can cleverly insult in the brief span of a combat round, as impressive as your burns might be.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Roast
entries: At 14th-level, you have learned to lift your companions’ morale while you tear apart the enemy’s. By specifying who in particular is going to kick the ass of whom during your Dirge of Doom, your allies’ confidence and fighting-spirit is built-up as much as your enemies’ is torn down.

Allies that can hear your Dirge of Doom gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the sum of the penalties applied to all enemies by your Dirge at the start of their turn. For example, if your Dirge’s penalty is currently two, and three creatures are affected by it, your ally would gain six temporary hit points at the start of their turn.
Additionally, allies that can hear your Dirge of Doom may add your current Dirge penalty to all weapon and spell damage rolls they make; this damage of a type the weapon or spell already deals.

subclassFeature.name: Flame Hammer Domain
entries: Amongst the ancient halls and great forge chambers of the Drukafaren, none revere the creations of the forge father Moradin more than clerics of the Flame Hammer. They see through the endless toil, and bountiful flame the forge father's gifts and endless blessings. Moradian teaches that, through struggle and strength, his followers may overcome any obstacle and forge their own path. Flame Hammers take this philosophy to heart as they baptize their armor and weapons in the blessed molten rivers of Mordain's forge in Dornarrvost. These imbued relics of the forge father give Flame Hammers the tools to create their own way and to overcome any that would desecrate or destroy Moradin's will. In one hand they wield the indestructible holy hammer of the dwarves while in the other, the inescapable wrath of Moradin's deific flame and molten metal.

Flame Hammers become adventurers to seek out and recover ancient temples, holy sites, and relics of Moradin. Many have been lost through the ages or have fallen into the hands of those unsuited to such relics. Flame Hammers will carve a path of burning fire and molten death to reach their prize for nothing stands in the way of the blazing hammers of the forge lord.

subclassFeature.name: Crucible Shield
entries: At 1st level, your faith in the gods of forge and flame arm you with a buffer of wreathing flames, superheated air, or floating, gleaming embers that blunt incoming strikes and enact divine retribution on your foes.

At the start of each of your turns in combat, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Cleric level. These temporary hit points stack with other sources of temporary hit points, but do not stack with themselves, and unless otherwise specified, they are lost first when you take damage.

When you take damage while you have the temporary hit points granted by your Crucible Shield, you may spend your reaction to deal fire damage equal to twice your Cleric level, plus your Wisdom modifier, to the creature who caused the damage, so long as that creature is within 60 feet of you.

Lastly, flickering remnants of your shield can guide your strikes. Once per round while you have temporary hit points from this feature and make a melee attack with a bludgeoning melee weapon, you may use your Wisdom modifier instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls; this is called a Crucible Strike.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency in heavy armor and all bludgeoning martial weapons.
Bludgeoning martial weapons count as a holy symbol and spellcasting focus for you.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Shield of the Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use Channel Divinity to grant a mote of the fire of your faith to guard your allies for a moment. As a bonus action, this ability grants a number of allies up to your proficiency bonus the benefit of a Crucible Shield of their own. This grants the temporary hit points one time, and they do not refresh once consumed unless you use this ability again.

Your allies may spend their reaction when damaged to deal damage to their attacker in the same way you can, using your Cleric level and Wisdom modifier to determine the amount of fire damage dealt. If your ally does not have a reaction to spend, or chooses not to spend it, you may spend your reaction on their behalf, so long as they and their attacker are both within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Fanning the Flames
entries: Beginning at 6th level, your power of faith fuels the flame of your Crucible Strikes. When you make a Crucible Strike, you add an additional number of fire damage dice equal to your proficiency modifier. By making Crucible Strikes consecutively, you can fan their flames to greater and greater intensity.

The size of the damage dice from this ability begins at a {@dice 1d4}. Each time you successfully land a Crucible Strike on a creature, the damage dice increases by one size, to a maximum of a {@dice d8}. The damage dice do not change if you attempt a Crucible Strike and miss, and if you do not make a Crucible Strike at some point during a round, the flames wither and the die size resets to a {@dice 1d4}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Blade of the Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use Channel Divinity to wreath your allies’ arms in the flames of your holy crucible. As a bonus action, this ability grants a number of allies up to your proficiency bonus the benefit of your Crucible Strike’s bonus damage. The next successful melee or ranged weapon attack that they make deals as much additional fire damage as your Crucible Strike would gain that round.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with the burning fury of the forge. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: True Forge Lord
entries: At 17th level, your blessed affinity with fire and metal reaches a point of near-absolute mastery. You gain immunity to fire damage, and while wearing heavy armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Woe Warden
entries: Druids of the Circle of Woe Wardens are nature's staunch defenders and terrible executioners. These primordial and cogent druids recognize that, while most living beings deserve a place in the natural cycle, creatures that corrupt and destroy the connate order must be purged for the benefit of the land itself. Woe wardens, as they are known, protect the creatures of the antediluvian woe forests by manipulating the essence of the very plants and trees to obliterate any that would cause them harm. Towering sprouting fields of razor keen vines or mighty walls of thick bark are at the command of the woe warden and their ever growing connection to nature itself.
All woe warden druids hold their sacred oath as the highest of honors for nature and do not think twice about the actions they must take to defend the world they hold dear.

Members of this circle become adventurers to destroy and to purge forces that threaten their lands or to seek out greater natural secrets hidden in the plants of the land. Wherever these druids go, all that dare to corrupt or destroy Therion will cower in fear for their righteous natural convictions will stop them.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Panoply
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to arm yourself with the traditional wargear of the Forests of Woe. At the end of a long rest, you may create the following for yourself:
-One suit of Ironbark Armor, granting an Armor Class of 14 + Dexterity modifier (maximum 2) when worn. The base value of the Ironbark Armor increases by 1 at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.
-One Ironbark Shield, granting a +2 to bonus to Armor Class when worn;
-Up to two Razorkeen Weapons, taking the shape of a Halberd or any other melee weapon in the Druid weapon proficiency list.
You are considered proficient with your Primordial Panoply. Additionally, your Razorkeen Weapons count as magical, and you may use your spell attack modifier when making melee attacks with them.
The damage dice of your Razorkeen Weapons increases by one at 10th and 14th level. These additional damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Grove of Woe
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you learn the Woe Warden’s signature ability, becoming a living conduit for the natural cycle of life, death, and rebirth. As a bonus action, you can magically conjure a 20’ radius of violent, entangling undergrowth around yourself for one minute; the radius remains centered on you, moving as you do.

The gnarled roots and thorny vines of the Grove of Woe cause the affected area to count as difficult terrain for enemies, including enemies not touching the ground, as the lashing tendrils grasp and inhibit them as well as they do opponents standing on solid earth. Additionally, the Grove of Woe causes one additional effect from the following list, chosen when the Grove is conjured:

items.name: tanglegrove
items.entry: Enemies that start their turn in the affected area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be Grappled until they make a successful Strength (Athletics) check against the same DC as an Action, or until the end of your next turn, whichever comes first.

items.name: Thorgrove
items.entry: nemies that move into the affected area take 1d4 points of magical piercing damage per square they enter. Forced movement, such as Shove attacks or the Thorn Whip cantrip, cause damage normally, in a similar manner to the Spike Growth spell.

items.name: Venomgrove
items.entry: Enemies that start their turn in the affected area must make a Constitution saving throw or be Poisoned until the end of your next turn.

entries: Enemies that are immune to difficult terrain are immune to the other effects of the Grove of Woe. The Grove counts as a spell effect of the highest-level spell slot you possess for the purposes of dispelling, though it cannot be counterspelled.
You can conjure your Grove of Woe a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn, so long as those attacks are made with your Primordial Panoply.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Grove
entries: At 10th level, the radius of your Grove of Woe increases to 30 feet. Additionally, each of the options for your Grove’s added effect is improved as follows:

items.name: tanglegrove
items.entry: Enemies are Restrained, instead of Grappled.

items.name: Thorgrove
items.entry: The damage is multiplied by your Proficiency Bonus, but no longer stacks with the Spike Growth spell.

items.name: Venomgrove
items.entry: Creatures that fail their saving throw are Poisoned for one minute instead.

subclassFeature.name: Steelbark & Spiterazor
entries: At 14th level, your Razorkeen weapons count as silver, and your Ironbark Armor functions similarly to Adamantine, rendering you immune to critical hits while worn. Additionally, if a creature hit by your Razorkeen weapons is vulnerable to, or possesses a Regeneration feature that is overcome by, a particular damage type, the extra damage dice gained at 10th and 14th level count as that damage type for those purposes.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Gallant Crusader
entries: The Oath of Protection calls to paladins whose burning drive is to shield the weak and defend the just. For these paladins, their lives and strength are a bulwark against the forces of evil and they will do all within their power to harbor those they care about. Most do this through the monolithic strength that is imbued to them by a blessed tower shield. These defenses are akin to a moving wall and are able to stand against even the strongest of strikes and mightiest of barrages. From behind their great bastions, Oath of Protection paladins summon forth great floating spiritual chains to help them defend against foes as they take on the brunt of danger.

The tenets of the Oath of the Gallant Crusader vary by knightly order and from one paladin to another, but all tend to follow a consistent set of just principles similar to the following. These are guiding principles, not harsh strictures, and as long as the Gallant Crusader knows in their heart that they have made the best choice available to them, they can hold their head high with their honor intact.

items.name: Evil Shall Know My Name:
items.entry: A righteous warrior’s reputation as keen a blade as the one he wields. When practical, a Gallant Crusader should introduce themselves to friend and foe alike, not out of a sense of pride, but to spread fear of their name among the ranks of the wicked.

items.name: Justice, in all things:
items.entry: A knight’s duty is to his people, the innocent lives they have sworn to spend theirs in guardianship of, especially if they are subordinates, serfs, servants, wards, or charges in the knight’s umbrella. The life and well-being of innocents, especially those in the knights’ care, must be protected, at any personal cost.

items.name: To Each their Own in the Eyes of the Law:
items.entry: A chevalier gallant can expect to travel to foreign lands and interact with unfamiliar customs. The way of life of an unfamiliar people should be respected, and the law of the land obeyed, except if those ways or those laws are undeniably corrupt, unnecessarily cruel, or brutally oppressive.

items.name: Mercy is for the Innocent
items.entry: The honor of a knightly crusader is paramount. Enemies should expect mercy if they yield truly, and terrible wrath should they yield falsely, as righteousness does not require one to cater to craven fools.

items.name: To Each their Own in the Eyes of the Law:
items.entry: A chevalier gallant can expect to travel to foreign lands and interact with unfamiliar customs. The way of life of an unfamiliar people should be respected, and the law of the land obeyed, except if those ways or those laws are undeniably corrupt, unnecessarily cruel, or brutally oppressive.

items.name: Inevitability of Righteousness:
items.entry: Gallant crusaders are often on journeys of their own, pilgrimages or sabbaticals in search of a divine artifact or a quest of self-discovery and deepening of their faith. An honorable knight must always perform what righteous acts they are able in their journeys, but must not expect to solve every problem, in every place, at every scale; it is a crusader’s right to choose what hill to die upon, and cannot be expected to attempt an unwinnable battle unless they choose to.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain Oath Spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Gallant Crusader Spells
rows: {@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Crusader’s Challenge
entries: At 3rd level as a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to present your arms and declare a righteous challenge to all who stand against you in battle. All enemies that can see you when you make your challenge must make a Wisdom saving throw. Enemies that fail have disadvantage on attack rolls against allied creatures other than you. The effects of your Crusader’s Challenge last for one minute, or until you are rendered unconscious.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Blessed Arcs
entries: At 3rd level as a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to empower your strikes and bring the full brunt of your righteous might to bear against your foes. Your attacks deal their minimum damage to all enemy creatures within your threatened area when you make the attack, and if you successfully hit a creature with an attack during this effect, it takes additional damage equal to the minimum damage roll of that attack as well. This effect includes all additional damage from spells, divine smites, weapon enchantments, or other sources. The effect of Blessed Arcs lasts for one minute, or until you are rendered unconscious.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Proficiencies
entries: You gain proficiency with tower shields and the {@skill Medicine} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Holy Bulwark
entries: At 7th level, your devotion to protecting your comrades-in-arms and the innocents in your care manifests as golden threads, chains, or other restraints upon your foes. You gain an aura. You may use your reaction when an enemy enters, moves through, or leaves the radius of your aura to attempt to halt them in place. Make an Athletics (Strength) or Athletics (Charisma) check to Shove the target, knocking them prone on a success and additionally reducing their speed to 0 until the start of your next turn.
The radius of your Aura of the Holy Bulward is 10 feet, increasing to 30 feet at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Immovable Object
entries: At 15th level, your steely resolve and trained stance make you an indomitable rock on the battlefield. You can no longer be knocked prone or forced to move against your will.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: At 20th level, your righteous fervor in defense of those you care about can manifest as the divine right to spite death. As an action, once per long rest, you may enter a state of divine spite for one minute. While in this state, as long as one ally or creature you consider innocent or otherwise in your care is alive that you can see or hear, you may make a Constitution saving throw when you reach zero hit points to remain conscious with one hit point instead. The DC of this Constitution saving throw starts at 10 and increases by 2 each time you attempt one.

subclassFeature.name: Fragment of Divinity
entries: Your path is one that will be heralded by the songs of ancients and gods alike. You have stumbled across a fragment of divinity and absorbed its very essence into your own being. The changes to come of such a radical choice are unknown as only one other, the god-king of humankind Zarus, has done such a feat. As you feel your power grow your own deific aura presents itself as your own guardian and champion. Those who draw too near are enraptured by your radiance and are crushed by the force of your godly being. In return for such powers, you feel your mortal mind slipping away thus making this transition to godhood a war of attrition against yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Fragment lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: A Piece of the Gods
entries: You possess a Fragment of Divinity, a small object of negligible weight that you must keep on or in your person at all times; if you lose it, you lose the benefits of this patron after a number of days equal to your warlock level, though they return immediately when the Fragment is returned.
You always know the direction of the shortest path to your Fragment of Divinity.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Soul
entries: Your Fragment of Divinity grants you the power to project the power of your soul, applying the force of your tiny mote of deific power to influence the world in your immediate vicinity and granting awareness of other carriers of similar fragments.
You can tell at a glance if another creature possesses a Fragment of Divinity, and can see their Manifest Soul, if they have one.

You have a Manifest Soul. Your Manifest Soul is an invisible, humanoid-shaped intangible force that you project no further than 30 feet from you at a time. Your Manifest Soul allows you to choose to originate your spells from any space within 30 feet of you, and augments your spell attacks in a unique way.

The Manifest Soul allows you to make ranged spell attacks as melee spell attacks instead, so long as the target is within 30 feet of you. If the spell deals damage, you may add your Constitution modifier to the damage rolls when casting the spell through your Manifest Soul in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: As long as you wear no armor and do not use a shield, you can choose for your Armor Class to be 10 + your Charisma modifier + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Imposing Splendor
entries: At 1st level, as a bonus action, you can present a pose displaying the majestic splendor of your ascended figure. So long as you benefit from the unarmored defense, this pose increases your AC by 2 until you move.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Rush
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you gain the Eldritch Blast cantrip if you do not already have it. When you use the Eldritch Blast cantrip through your Manifest Soul, the spell produces one more beam than normal, as long as you are not in an area of magical silence or otherwise unable to speak  and, thus, can let out a valiant cry with every strike.

subclassFeature.name: Physical Manifestation
entries: At 10th level, your Manifest Soul can take physical actions on your behalf, allowing you to make attacks with weapons, manipulate objects, shove or grapple, or any other task you could accomplish yourself, within 30 feet of you. The Manifest Soul uses your Charisma score instead of Strength for these purposes.

You are treated as carrying any objects the Manifest Soul carries for the purposes of determining whether or not you are encumbered. The Manifest Soul shares your current effective size for determining whether or not it can attempt to shove or grapple a creature.

The Manifest Soul can grant you or any other ally within 30 feet of you a fly speed of 60 feet, so long as they do not move more than 30 feet from you; activating this ability does not require an action, but no more than one creature may benefit from it per round.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Awe, Powerful Menace
entries: At 14th level, when you use your Imposing Splendor to improve your armor class, allies within 30 feet of you gain the bonus as well.

Each turn that you spend your bonus action to pose, enemies that can see you or that can see your Manifest Soul must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be Frightened until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Firearm.
entries: The firearm property functions as the {@b {@i Ammunition}} and {@b {@i Loading}} properties, except that you can forego one attack or use a bonus action to reload it in order to fire it again on the same turn. Reloading a firearm requires two hands unless otherwise specified.
Any blacksmith could conceivably build, alter, or repair a firearm if given the designs or a specimen to copy.

entries.name: Spread.
entries: When attacking a target within half this weapon's normal range, roll an additional damage die and add it to the weapon's damage. When fired at long range, you may apply the attack roll to an additional creature within 5 feet of the target. Roll damage against the secondary target separately.

entries.name: Gun Blade
entries: As an action or bonus action you may attack a creature with the weapons secondary attack, usually a bayonet or saw, as if it were a standard melee weapon.

entries.name: Dwarven
entries: Weapons with this property require a creature to have a dwarven racial specific trait or take the Dwarven Weapon Training feat to use.

entries.name: Gith
entries: Weapons with this property require a creature to be of race: Gith or take the Gith Weapon Training feat to use.

entries.name: Kenku
entries: Weapons with this property require a creature to be of race: Kenku or take the Kenku Weapon Training feat to use.

entries.name: Exotic
entries: No characters are proficient with exotic weapons by default. To become proficient with an exotic weapon, a character must be trained in the use of that specific weapon.

entries.name: Double
entries: When you take the Attack action and attack with a double weapon that you're holding, you can use a bonus action to attack again with the other part of the weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Improved Critical
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack using this weapon, roll the weapon dice three times instead of twice.

entries.name: Handy
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling, as well as against creatures that are grappling you.

entries.name: Savage
entries: Savage weapons combine speed, weight and penetration, enabling them to deal decisive blows in combat. When you roll a 19 on an attack roll, roll an additional d6. If you roll the number given in parentheses next to the weapon, or higher, you score a critical hit. If the weapon has the versatile property reduce the number in the parentheses by 1, when it is wielded in two hands. If there is no number in parentheses, no need to roll a d6, a 19 is an automatic critical hit.

entries.name: Shield Wrap
entries: You gain a +1 to attack rolls against opponents wielding a shield.

entries.name: Parry
entries: When you are wielding a weapon with the parry property and a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add 1 to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You must have a Dexterity score of 13 or higher to take advantage of this feature, which can be used in conjunction with the Defensive Duelist feat.

entries.name: Riposte
entries: The speed of this weapon allows you to turn defence into attack. Whenever using the parry property of your weapon causes an attack to miss you, as part of the same reaction you make make a retaliatory melee attack, using your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Bleed
entries: Bleeding creatures must make a Consitution save vs DC 13 at the end of their turns, or take 1d6 non-mitigatable damage. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. Multiple instances of bleeding stack (max 3).
A DC 13 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon requires 15 strength to weild.
Powerful: When you roll a 19 on an attack roll, roll an additional {@dice 1d6}. If the result is higher than a 3 you score a critical hit with this weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon does not require a free hand.
This weapon may be used as a monk weapon.
Bleeding Fist: Once per turn you may take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage to increase this weapons damage dice to {@dice 2d6} for one attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Wrap: A Medium or smaller creature hit by a bolas must succeed a DC 10 Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A bolas has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Large or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the bolas (AC 12) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the bolas. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a bolas, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon can be used as a monk weapon.
A monk using deflect missiles while wielding this weapon may roll {@dice 2d6} instead of {@dice 1d10} to determine the amount of damage reduced.

item.name: Chain-and-dagger
entries: This weapon can be used as a monk weapon.

Dagger Wall: If you are weilding this weapon and successfully reduce damage to zero using deflect missile, you may make a free attack action immediately after calculating the result of deflect missle.

item.name: Chakram
entries: This weapon can be used as a monk weapon.
Mighty Critical: this weapon crits on a 19-20.
This weapon inflicts one stack of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon can be used as a monk weapon.
double threat: If you successfully attack with this weapon you may roll the damage roll twice. If the attack is a critical you may roll damage four times.

entries.name: Special
entries: this weapon requires a minimum of 18 strength to wield.

Double: When you take the Attack action and attack with a double weapon that you're holding, you can use a bonus action to attack again with the other part of the weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Special
entries: this weapon requires a minimum of 18 dexterity to wield.

Double: When you take the Attack action and attack with a double weapon that you're holding, you can use a bonus action to attack again with the other part of the weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Special
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
Flexible damage: This weapon is both a hammer and an axe. You may choose to strike with eaither end. The axe deals {@dice 1d6} slashing damage and the hammer deals {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning.

entries.name: Special
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
Mighty Critical: this weapon crits on a 19-20.

entries.name: Special
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by elves or those with training in elven weaponry.
Double Shot: You may fire two arrows from this bow when you make an attack. When you make an attack action you may make two seperate attacks with the secondary attack having disadvantage.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have advantage on Deterity (Stealth) checks made to conceal this weapon.
Deadly Breath: When you make an attack with this weapon, you may fire three darts instead of one. Make a separate attack roll with each dart.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon requires 20 Strength to wield.
Power Critical: When you score a critical hit with the Fullblade you may double your Strength damage modifier, as well as the damage dice.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon may only be wielded by a halfling or gnome or those with training in wimmelbilder weaponry.
Mighty Bloody Critical: this weapon crits on a 19-20. On a successful critical hit, the target gains 2 bleed stacks.

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon may only be wielded by a halfling or gnome or those with training in wimmelbilder weaponry.
Launcher: This weapon can be used to launch flasks or bottles of liquid.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon may only be wielded by a halfling or gnome or those with training in wimmelbilder weaponry.
Trip: If this weapon successfully lands an attack, the creature must make a DC 13 (acrobatics) check or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Special
entries: You must have 16 strength and 15 dexterity to wield this weapon
Power Blow: Creatures successfully damaged by this weapon are knocked prone and are move five feet away from you.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon may only be wielded by a halfling or gnome or those with training in wimmelbilder weaponry.
OW My Head: If you land a critical hit with this weapon the creature is stunned until they are able to roll a DC 10 (constitution) saving throw.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon may only be wielded by a halfling or gnome or those with training in wimmelbilder weaponry.

Rocky: If you hit a target with this weapon, you may choose to make an attack against another target within 5 feet of the first. The attack roll has disadvantage and deals the mimimum damage for the dice rolled.

entries.name: Special
entries: Yar she blows: If you hit a creature that is Large or smaller with this weapon, you can pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon can be used as a monk weapon.
Ankle Slice: When you attempt to knock a target prone while holding this weapon, you have advantage on the action.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a successful critical hit, this weapon inflicts 3 bleed stacks.

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

entries.name: Special
entries: Mantis Claw:The first opportuity attack you make with this weapon each round does not use your reaction.

entries.name: Special
entries: Liquid Form: This weapon is concealed in a tiny flask with a long neck to use as a handle. Upon opening the top of the flask a great mercurial blade errupts forth. You gain advanatge on checks to conceal this weapon in its unopened form
Poison: This weapon innately deals poison damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: Liquid Form: This weapon is concealed in a tiny flask with a long neck to use as a handle. Upon opening the top of the flask a great mercurial blade errupts forth. You gain advanatge on checks to conceal this weapon in its unopened form
Poison: This weapon innately deals poison damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: Double: When you take the Attack action and attack with a double weapon that you're holding, you can use a bonus action to attack again with the other part of the weapon. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage of the bonus attack, unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Special
entries: Slave Taking: If you successfully attack with this weapon, the create takes {@dice 5d4} bludgeoning damage and gains the {@condition restrained} condition. A DC 18 (strength) check can remove the device.
It is a full round action to successfully repack the OOrc Shotput before it may be used again.

entries.name: Special
entries: Clawed Hand: When you attempt to disarm a target with an attack while holding this weapon, you have advantage on the attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Repeat Load: It is a free action to reload this crossbow

entries.name: Special
entries: Repeat Load: It is a free action to reload this crossbow

entries.name: Special
entries: Hooked: When you attempt to trip a target with an attack while holding this weapon, you have advantage on the attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Upon landing a successful attack this weapon inflicts 1 bleed stack.

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

entries.name: Special
entries: Upon landing a successful attack this weapon inflicts 1 bleed stack.

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

entries.name: Special
entries: Air Whif: You may use half your movement to wrap a spinning javelin with string and tie the string to your finger.
If you use a spinning javelin without wrapping the javelin with string and tying it to your finger, treat it as a normal {@item javelin|phb}.
While wielding the spinning javelin, any attack directed at you involving a projectile has -2 to hit.
This weapon deals {@dice 1d8} piercing damage when used for a melee attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Extendo fist: as an action you can make a ranged attack (up to 15 feet) with this weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: last line of defense: A stump knife can only be equipped to an arm which has had its hand amputated.
A stump knife cannot be disarmed.

entries.name: Special
entries: breakdown: you have advantage on concealing this weapon

entries.name: Special
entries: A Medium or smaller creature hit by a two-ball bolas must succeed a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} until it is freed. A two-ball bolas has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Large or larger. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a bolas, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Special
entries: arcing slash: When you make a melee weapon attack with an Two bladed sword, you may choose to target two creatures within your reach with a single attack. This attack uses the same attack roll for both targets and deals slashing damage equal to 1d6 plus your Strength modifier to each target.

entries.name: Special
entries: Attacks with this weapon are considered unarmed strikes.
Powerful punch: When you make an unarmed strike while holding this weapon, add double your Strength modifier to the damage roll.

item.name: Giant Slaying Sword
entries: It was too big to be called a sword. Massive, thick, heavy, and far too rough. Indeed, this weapons is a heap of sharpened raw iron. This weapon requires 20 Strength to wield and deals {@dice 2d8} damage when wielded.

Rend: If you succesfully land an attack with this weapon you may continue to make subsequent attacks against creatures adjacent to you. Every creature you attack after the first gains a -5 penalty to the attack roll.

item.name: Small Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Ice Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Thunder Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Acid Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} acid damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Force Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Percing Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Necrotic Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Small Radiant Explosive
entries: This iron ball is filled with alchemical explosives and has a short fuse extending from it. As an action, a character can light and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each character within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. This item weighs 1 lb.

item.name: Round Buckler
entries: This small metal shield is held by a simple handle for ease of maneuvering. It increases your Armor Class by 1 (replacing the shield's normal bonus to AC) and you are proficient in its use if you are proficient with light armor. It also weighs half as much as a regular shield and can be donned or doffed without using an action.

item.name: Dwarven Eagle Axe
entries: This mighty silver and gem-bladed weapon deals {@dice 1d10} slashing damage when wielded one handed and {@dice 1d12} slashing damage when wielded with two hands.
this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.

Eagle Cleave: When you take the Attack action while wielding a Dwarven Eagle Axe, you may make one additional attack as a bonus action, using the “opposite” head of the axe. You do not add your Strength modifier to the damage of this attack unless you have the Two-Weapon Fighting fighting style.

item.name: Dwarven Titan Hammer
entries: This power hammer shaped like a might titan deals {@dice 1d12} damage when wielded.
This weapon inflicts one stack of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Dwarven Thorned Spear
entries: This jagged heavy spear deals {@dice 1d6} damage
this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
When you successfuly damage a living creature with this weapon on your turn, if they attempt to move away from your threatened range on their turn they take 1d6 piercing damage

item.name: Dwarven Sharp Throwing Hammer
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by dwarves or those with training in dwarven weaponry.
This heavy small hammer, while commonly used for construction, makes for a great improvised throwing weapon. This weapon deals {@dice 1d6} slashing damage.

item.name: Katana
entries: This gently curved sword allows a properly trained wielder to make blindingly quick strikes.This weapon has the finesse property and deals {@dice 1d8} damage while wielded one handed and {@dice 1d10} while weilded in two hands.
blade master: At the start of combat, you gain advantage on your first attack with this weapon.

item.name: Ritual Scythe
entries: This common farming tool is a common weapon used by cultists and those who worship death. The Ritual Scythe deals {@dice 1d8} damage
Drained Blade: Every time you kill a creature with the ritual scythe, your next successful attack deals an additional 1d8 necrotic damage.

item.name: Gith Mind Blade
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by Gith or those with training in Korasiam weaponry.
This verstatile blade actually uses mental energy to create a sharp plasma based blade. THe Gith Mind blade deals {@dice 1d4} damage one handed and {@dice 1d6} two handed
This weapon can be used as an arcane focus for the purposes of casting spells.
Spells dealing psychic damage deal an additional damage die.

item.name: Gith Mind Whip
entries: this weapon may only be wielded by Gith or those with training in Korasiam weaponry.
This peculiar verstatile whip uses mental energy to create a sharp plasma based blade. THe Gith Mind Whip deals {@dice 1d4} damage one handed and {@dice 1d6} two handed
This weapon can be used as an arcane focus for the purposes of casting spells.
Spells dealing psychic damage deal an additional damage die.

item.name: Tower Shield
entries: This thick, unwieldy shield is large enough to cover you from ankle to shoulder. It increases your armor class by 3 (this replaces the shield's normal bonus to AC.) While this shield is equipped, you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and if your Strength score is lower than 15, your speed is reduced by 10 feet as if you were wearing heavy armor. It weighs twice as much as a regular shield.
Shield Wall: As a action you may angle your shield become a haven against arrows. Your speed is reduced to zero and you gain +10 to your ac against ranged melee attacks.

item.name: Dwarven Tower Shield
entries: This inhuman stone slab is enchanted with countless runes and is ordained with jewels and precious metals. It increases your armor class by 3 (this replaces the shield's normal bonus to AC.) While this shield is equipped, you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and if your Strength score is lower than 15, your speed is reduced by 10 feet as if you were wearing heavy armor.

Mountain Wall: As an action you may slam your shield into the ground and 'lock down'. While in this stance the shield acts as a 5 ft. full cover wall (200 HP. 22 AC) and is resistant to all damage types. It takes an action to lift your shield out of the ground.
The most common and yet most deadly firearm, cog revolvers are staples of most modern armies.Cog revolvers use cartridge ammunition and do {@dice 1d8} piercing damage.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Highnoon: As an action you may speed fire all the ammunition in the revolver. You may make separate attacks at creatures within range at disadvantage for every round fired. It takes half the rounds fired (rounded down) for the gun to cool down so it may be reloaded.

The short range but powerful boomstick is a common weapon of riflemen as it is able to unleash close range destruction. The boomstick does {@dice 4d4} piercing damage and consume two ammunition per shot.
breakaction: As a bonus acction you may reload all ammunition in this weapon.

A powerful long range weapon able to send destruction down range, steam rifles are common place amongst scouts. Steam rifles deal {@dice 3d6} piercing damage and use cartridge ammunition. It takes an action to reload the steam rifle

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Steady Shot: As an action you may crouch to steady your aim. Your movement speed is reduced to zero and you are treated as prone.  While in this state you gain an additonal +5 to all attack rolls made with the steam rifle. It is an action to stand up.
This peculiar weapon uses a harmonica like magazine to pass bullets into into the chamber.
Quick Load: It is a Bonus action to reload this weapon with a premade harmonica clip.
This strange four barreled box loads four shells at a time to be used. Inaccurate but wildly effective against multiple targets clumped together.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Bulky: Firearms and ranged weapons with the bulky property have to be made stable in order to be fired effectively due to their weight and the damage they can put out with a single shot. You cannot attack more than once during your turn while wielding a bulky firearm.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Firing Platform: as a bonus action you may stand the base of the arquebus into the ground. Your movement speed becomes zero and any attacks with the arquebus have advantage. It is a free action to abandon the arqebus and a full round action to restock the stand.

A tried and true firearm from the United Empires to the West, the Dragoon is a testament to engineering as it is capable of being used in any weather or battle condition. The dragoon deals {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage.

Shell Loading:Firearms with the shell loading property require you to reload your gun by inserting each piece of ammunition in at a time. As a bonus action, you can reload three pieces of ammunition into the weapon on your turn. Alternatively, you can spend an action during your turn to reload every piece of ammunition into the gun at once.

Scatter: Firearms with the scatter property have two types of damage, a regular damage roll and a scatter damage roll. When you make an attack roll with one of these guns against a creature, compare your attack roll to the AC of all creatures within 5 feet of the target. If your attack would hit them, deal the firearm's scatter damage roll to the creatures. You do not add your ability score modifier to the damage of this attack, unless that modifier is negative.

Bulky: Firearms and ranged weapons with the bulky property have to be made stable in order to be fired effectively due to their weight and the damage they can put out with a single shot. You cannot attack more than once during your turn while wielding a bulky firearm.

Firestarter: You can make a normal single-target attack with a flamethrower using 1 unit of ammunition, or you can spray everything in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot long line by dispensing 10 units of Ammunition. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take the flamethrower's normal damage. The flames of the flamethrower linger for six rounds and any creature who enters,starts, or ends the space of the flame takes the full damage of the flame thrower.
This item requires a special backpack item called a 'Fuel Tank' to be used. It is a full round action to attach a fuel tank to the flamethrower. Fuel Tanks carry 50 units of ammunition.
Magazine Load: It is an action to reload this weapon with a premade Rifle clip.

Burst Fire: Burst fire firearms are able to make a special attack that releases a stream of multiple bullets. As an action, you can force up to 3 creatures of your choice in a 15-foot square centered on a point within your gun's maximum range to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking your gun's burst fire damage on a failed save, and half that damage on a success. This action subtracts rounds from your gun equal to the number of creatures affected, to a maximum of 3.
Additionally, guns with the burst fire property always expend 3 rounds per attack.
Burst Fire Save DC (Not Proficienct) = 12
Burst Fire Save DC (Proficient) = 8 + Dexterity + Profiicency Bonus

item.name: Crow Quill
entries: This strange combination of chained throwing knives and rope daggers seems to be obtuse to use but in the hands of a deadly kenku can have serious side effects for ones health.
this weapon may only be wielded by Kenku or those with training in Goldwing Rookery weaponry.
This weapon inflicts two stacks of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Talon Hook
entries: This strange club contains a hollowed interior able to produce astonisingly powerful wind gusts. Those hit by it have their skin rended open.
this weapon may only be wielded by Kenku or those with training in Goldwing Rookery weaponry.
This weapon inflicts two stacks of bleeding on a successful attack

Bleeding: creatures that gain a stack of bleeding take 1d6 non-mitigatable slashing damage on the start of their turn. Beating DC 18 ends this condition. A DC 16 Wisdom (Medicine) check or magical healing will stop the bleeding.
a creature can accrue multiple stacks of bleeding (max 6). Each time a stack is accrued the damage at the start of their turn is increased by one damage dice to a maximum of (6d6).

item.name: Stone Armor
entries: This finely crafted dwarven masterpiece is the peak of protection. If an attack were to be a critical hit against you, you take non-critical damage. This effect can only happens once per round of combat.

item.name: Hunter's Armor
entries: Designed for Huntsmen going into combat, Hunter's Armor is able to absorb blows better than any other material. Once per day you can choose to negate all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage taken during a turn. This ability must be used before a damage roll is calculated.

item.name: Void Armor
entries: This terrifying armor made of pure void stone is nigh impervious to most standard atacks.
